intro: Knoxia stricta var. parviflora, commonly known as the narrowleaf knoxia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it blooms during the summer months. Knoxia stricta var. parviflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
